prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Athena Cykes
Description: A new lawyer at my agency. She studied psychology while she was in Europe.
Character 1
Name: Apollo Justice
Description: An ardent young lawyer in my agency. His special feature is his very loud voice.
Character 2
Name: Trucy Wright
Description: My daughter, who also happens to be an aspiring magician. I adopted her eight years ago.
Character 3
Name: Sasha Buckler
Description: An orca trainer and performer in the Swashbuckler Spectacular. She appears to be best friends with Orla.
Character 4
Name: Bobby Fulbright
Description: The detective assigned to this case. He sure makes a lot of noise, but he appears to be on the side of justice.
Character 5
Name: Ora Shipley
Description: The orca accused of murder. Though "Ora" is her real name, people like to call her "Orla". She likes to wear hats.
Character 6
Name: Jack Shipley
Description: The owner of Shipshape Aquarium. He was found dead in the orca pool.
Character 7
Name: Norma DePlume
Description: An aquarium visitor. She seems to know something about what happened.
Character 8
Name: Marlon Rimes
Description: Shipshape Aquarium's new animal keeper. He loves animals as much as he loves rapping.
Character 9
Name: Rifle
Description: A penguin that always shoots straight at her mark. She seems to love the smell of fish.
Character 10
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: A spirit medium in training. Her psychic powers are beyond question.
Character 11
Name: Simon Blackquill
Description: A prosecutor and prison inmate. He has mastered the use of psychological manipulation in courtroom battles.
Character 12
Name: Herman Crab
Description: Shipshape Aquarium's resident vet. A baby penguin lives in his hair.
Character 13
Name: Azura Summers
Description: The trainer who preceded Sasha. She died during a show on July 20th last year.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. Proof of my profession.
Evidence 1
Name: Swashbuckler Flyer
Description: An advertisement showing an orca dressed up like a pirate. It was dropped by a penguin. An advertisement for a new show. It was dropped by a penguin. An advertisement for a new show. It appears that Sasha was not slated to return.
Evidence 2
Name: Photo of the Body
Description: A crime scene photo taken in the orca pool room. It's hard to make out details of the body. Crime scene photos taken in the orca pool room. (2 photos.)
Evidence 3
Name: Orca Pool Diagram
Description: A cross-section view of the 1st- and 2nd-floor sections of the orca pool. The pool is about 65 feet deep. A cross-section view of the 1st- and 2nd-floor sections of the orca pool. Pearls apparently entered the staff corridor. It also has information about the area around the orca pool on the first and second floor. The pool is about 65 feet deep.
Evidence 4
Name: Whistle
Description: A whistle for issuing instructions to Orla. Anyone can use one to command her, as long as they know the right signals. Orla performs one trick per signal. She can't do two at a time.
Evidence 5
Name: Security Footage
Description: Video showing the orca pool from the visitor's corridor. The footage starts at the aquarium's 10 AM opening time. Video showing the orca pool. The footage starts at the aquarium's 10 AM opening time. (2 pages.)
Evidence 6
Name: Fish
Description: A large quantity of fish for feeding Rifle the penguin. Not surprisingly, it has a horribly fishy smell!
Evidence 7
Name: Walkie-Talkie
Description: Issued to all aquarium staff for communication. It can apparently also be used to broadcast inside the aquarium.
Evidence 8
Name: Calendar
Description: A penguin-shaped calendar that Pearls bought at the aquarium. It smells fishy for some reason. Apparently belongs to Rimes. It was accidently [sic] switched with Pearls's calendar around 10:10 AM. Apparently belongs to Sasha. A meeting with the victim was scheduled for 7 AM on the 20th. It turns out this doesn't belong to Sasha. A meeting with the victim was scheduled for 7 AM on the 20th. A calendar that Azura Summers gave to Dr. Crab. A meeting with the victim was scheduled for 7 AM on the 20th.
Evidence 9
Name: Bloodstained Coin
Description: A single coin seems to have fallen by the side of the orca pool. Discovered by the side of the orca pool. There are 300 coins in all, weighing 7 pounds total. This makes it a likely murder weapon.
Evidence 10
Name: Swashbuckler Video
Description: A TV recording of a performance featuring Orla, Sasha and Jack Shipley as pirates. The show song on the video is different from the one DePlume heard.
Evidence 11
Name: TV Phone
Description: A cell phone used by Shipshape Aquarium staff. This model can connect to TVs and be used to conduct teleconferencing. Summers's boyfriend has videos of her using a whistle to make the orca do tricks. A cell phone used by Shipshape Aquarium staff. Videos of Summers can be viewed. (2 pages.)
Evidence 12
Name: Shipley's Data
Description: Instant death from a brain contusion. There are signs of blunt force trauma all over the body. [info] Cause of Death: Contusion from head trauma. Bruised all over body. Death thought to be result of orca attack. Estimated Time of Death: Under Investigation. Instant death from a brain contusion. There are signs of blunt force trauma all over the body. Details updated. [info] Est. Time of Death: From 12:00 to 10:00 AM on July 20th. Cause of Death: Contusion from head trauma. Thought to be from 65-ft fall into pool. Bruised all over. Ceiling to pool bottom is 100 ft. Blow to head received after death. Shipley's walkie-talkie hasn't been found. (3 pages.)
Evidence 13
Name: "The Killer Killer Whale"
Description: A nonfiction book by Norma DePlume. It's about the case from last year.
Evidence 14
Name: Security Card
Description: A key card for gaining access to the orca pool. Only the victim and Sasha had one.
Evidence 15
Name: Prescription Bag
Description: Seized from Sasha's residence. She apparently had this filled at the Hickfield Clinic.
Evidence 16
Name: Skull Rock
Description: There's a bloodstain on the rock. The victim may have struck it when he fell to his death. A new show prop that was at the orca pool. The victim struck it when he fell. Moved from the show pool during cleaning time. The victim struck it when he fell to his death. The victim slammed into it when he fell. Orla also rammed into it. It had been moved from the show pool.
Evidence 17
Name: Pool Bottom Photo
Description: A photo of the bottom of the pool. The locations of the bloodstains detected with luminol are sketched in. [caption] The pool is partitioned into two sections by a tall glass.
Evidence 18
Name: Mysterious Capsule → "3 Zs" Sleeping Pill
Description: The strange capsule that was found in Orla's stomach. "3 Zs" is printed on it. The strange capsule that was found in Orla's stomach. It's a sleeping pill, not some kind of poison.
Evidence 19
Name: Handmade Sign
Description: A sign Sasha made for the new show. It's been left to dry since the early hours of the 20th.
Evidence 20
Name: Ladder Prints
Description: The fingerprints discovered by Pearls at the show stage. They're Rimes's, but there's something odd about them.
Evidence 21
Name: Charm
Description: Discovered in Rifle's stomach. It might belong to Azura Summers's boyfriend.
Evidence 22
Name: TORPEDO Data
Description: TORPEDO data shows that Rifle ate around 4:00 AM on July 20th, but that Orla didn't eat anything.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: In the early morning hours of July 20th, Sasha was cleaning the orca pool room.
Person: Crab
Testimony 1
Testimony: Sasha and Jack Shipley, the owner, were scheduled to do the cleaning together.
Person: Crab
Testimony 2
Testimony: The record of card usage shows that Sasha entered the orca pool room.
Person: Crab
Testimony 3
Testimony: During cleaning, the pool water is drained.
Person: Crab
Testimony 4
Testimony: While the cleaning was going on, Marlon was taking care of the orca in the show pool.
Person: Crab
Testimony 5
Testimony: The pool water would never be drained unless the pool was being cleaned.
Person: Crab
Testimony 6
Testimony: If there were no water in the pool, the orca might die.
Person: Crab

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. I need to find a pair of evidence and testimony that contradict each other. Let's start by looking at the testimonies and evidences provided.

First, looking at the testimonies from Character 12 (Herman Crab):

Testimony 0: Sasha was cleaning the orca pool room in the early morning of July 20th.
Testimony 1: Sasha and Jack were supposed to clean together.
Testimony 2: The security card record shows Sasha entered the orca pool.
Testimony 3: During cleaning, the pool water is drained.
Testimony 4: Marlon was taking care of the orca in the show pool during cleaning.
Testimony 5: The pool water is only drained during cleaning.
Testimony 6: If the pool was drained, the orca might die.

Now, looking at the evidences, especially Evidence 17 (Pool Bottom Photo) mentions that the pool is partitioned into two sections by tall glass. The caption says the pool is partitioned, so maybe there's a show pool and another section. 

Evidence 16 (Skull Rock) states that the Skull Rock was moved from the show pool during cleaning. Also, the victim struck it when falling. 

Wait, Testimony 3 says that during cleaning, the pool water is drained. If the pool was drained, then the orca would be in danger (Testimony 6). But Evidence 16 mentions the Skull Rock was moved from the show pool during cleaning. If the main pool was drained, how could the orca be in the show pool? Because the pool is partitioned (Evidence 17), maybe the show pool is separate. 

But Testimony 4 says Marlon was taking care of the orca in the show pool during cleaning. That makes sense if the main pool was being drained, but the orca was in the show pool which wasn't drained. 

Now, looking for contradictions. Let me check Evidence 12 (Shipley's Data) which says the estimated time of death was between 12:00 to 10:00 AM on July 20th. If cleaning was happening in the early morning (Testimony 0 says early morning of July 20th), then the victim's death time overlaps with the cleaning time. 

Wait, but the key point might be about the pool being drained. If the pool was drained during cleaning (Testimony 3 and 5), then any injuries from a fall into the pool wouldn't be possible because there's no water. However, the autopsy (Evidence 12) says the cause of death was a brain contusion from a fall into the pool (65 ft fall). If the pool was drained, then the victim couldn't have fallen into it. That's a contradiction.

So, Testimony 3 and 5 state that during cleaning, the pool is drained. If the cleaning was happening when the victim was killed, then the pool was empty, making the 65 ft fall impossible. Therefore, the autopsy report (Evidence 12) mentions the death was from a fall into the pool, which would require the pool to have water. Thus, if the cleaning (and draining) was happening at the time of the murder, the two contradict.

Alternatively, maybe the time frames don't align. Let me check the timeline. Testimony 0 says cleaning was in the early morning of July 20th. The estimated time of death (Evidence 12) is from 12:00 to 10:00 AM on July 20th. So if cleaning was happening during that time, the pool would be drained. But the death requires the pool to have water. Hence, contradiction between Evidence 12 (cause of death from falling into the pool) and Testimony 3/5 (pool was drained during cleaning, which was happening at the time of death).

Therefore, the contradiction is between Evidence 12 and Testimony 3 or 5. Let's pick the most direct one. Testimony 3 says during cleaning, the pool is drained. If the cleaning was ongoing when the death occurred, then the pool was empty, contradicting the cause of death involving a fall into the pool. So the answer would be Evidence 12 and Testimony 3 or 5. Let me check the exact wording again.

Looking at Testimony 5: "The pool water would never be drained unless the pool was being cleaned." So if the pool was drained (during cleaning), then the fall into water couldn't happen. The autopsy says the death was from a fall into the pool (implying water was present). Therefore, if the pool was drained (due to cleaning), then the cause of death as per Evidence 12 can't be correct. Thus, the contradiction is between Evidence 12 and Testimony 3 or 5. 

Looking at the options, the user wants one pair. Let me check which testimony directly states the pool was drained during the time of death. Testimony 3 says during cleaning, the pool is drained. Testimony 5 reiterates that draining only happens during cleaning. Since the estimated time of death overlaps with cleaning time (early morning), the pool would be drained, contradicting the cause of death involving falling into the pool. Therefore, the correct pair is Evidence 12 and Testimony 3 or 5. 

Alternatively, maybe another evidence. Let me check other evidences. Evidence 17's caption mentions the pool is partitioned. If the victim fell into the show pool which wasn't drained, that might resolve the contradiction, but the testimony says during cleaning, the main pool is drained. The Skull Rock was moved from the show pool (Evidence 16). Maybe the victim fell into the show pool which was not drained. However, the testimony says during cleaning, the main pool is drained, but the show pool might still have water. Testimony 4 mentions the orca was in the show pool during cleaning, implying that pool had water. So perhaps the victim fell into the show pool, which wasn't drained. In that case, there's no contradiction. Hmm, maybe I need to reconsider.

Wait, the Skull Rock was moved from the show pool during cleaning (Evidence 16). The victim struck it when falling. If the cleaning involved moving the rock from the show pool to the main pool, but the main pool was drained, then the victim fell into the main pool (which was empty?), but that contradicts the cause of death. Alternatively, maybe the victim fell into the show pool which had water. The problem is the testimony says during cleaning, the pool (main?) is drained, but if the show pool wasn't, then the death could happen there. 

This is getting a bit tangled. Let me focus again. The autopsy (Evidence 12) says the victim fell 65 feet into the pool. The pool's depth is 65 feet (Evidence 3). If during cleaning, the main pool is drained, but the show pool (which is partitioned) still has water, then the death could occur there. The testimony mentions the pool (main) is drained during cleaning, but the show pool might be separate. Therefore, maybe there's no contradiction. 

Wait, the Testimony 5 says "the pool water would never be drained unless the pool was being cleaned." The term "the pool" might refer to the orca pool. Evidence 3 says the orca pool is partitioned into two sections. So perhaps the main orca pool is being drained, but the show pool isn't. Therefore, the death could occur in the show pool, which had water. Then there's no contradiction. 

Hmm, maybe I need to look elsewhere. Let's check Evidence 17's Pool Bottom Photo caption: "The pool is partitioned into two sections by a tall glass." So two sections. The cleaning might involve draining one section. If the victim fell into the non-drained section, then the testimony's point about draining during cleaning doesn't contradict the cause of death. 

Alternatively, maybe the Security Card (Evidence 14) only Sasha and victim had access. But that might not relate. 

Looking back, perhaps another contradiction. Testimony 0 says Sasha was cleaning the orca pool room in the early morning. Evidence 14 is the Security Card which only Sasha and victim had. If Sasha entered (Testimony 2), but if the victim was killed during that time, maybe Sasha's presence is an alibi or not. Not sure.

Alternatively, Testimony 4 says Marlon was taking care of the orca in the show pool during cleaning. If the cleaning was happening, but the orca was in the show pool, that's okay. 

Wait, maybe the contradiction is between Evidence 12's cause of death (fall into pool) and Testimony 6, which says if the pool was drained, the orca might die. But the orca survived, so the pool wasn't drained. Wait, Testimony 6 says if the pool was drained, the orca might die. If the orca is alive, then the pool wasn't drained, contradicting Testimony 3 and 5 that during cleaning it was drained. But if the cleaning happened but the pool wasn't drained, that contradicts. But the testimony says during cleaning the pool is drained. 

Alternatively, maybe the victim's death caused the orca to be in danger? Not sure. 

Alternatively, looking at Evidence 16's Skull Rock was moved from the show pool during cleaning. If cleaning was happening, then the show pool was accessible, and moving the rock there might be part of cleaning. But if the pool was drained, then moving the rock would be possible. 

Hmm, perhaps the key contradiction is between Evidence 12 (death from falling into the pool) and Testimony 3/5 (pool was drained during cleaning, which was happening at the time of death). Therefore, the correct pair would be Evidence 12 and Testimony 3. 

Alternatively, Testimony 5 says the pool is only drained during cleaning. If the death occurred during cleaning, then the pool was drained, making the fall into water impossible. Thus, the cause of death in Evidence 12 contradicts the testimony. 

Therefore, the answer is Evidence 12 and Testimony 3 or 5. Let me check the exact testimony numbers. Testimony 3 is "During cleaning, the pool water is drained." Testimony 5 is "The pool water would never be drained unless the pool was being cleaned." 

The contradiction is between Evidence 12 (death from falling into the pool, implying water present) and Testimony 3 (pool was drained during cleaning, which was happening at the time of death). So the pair is Evidence 12 and Testimony 3.
</think>

cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. The user wants me to find a pair of evidence and testimony that contradict each other. I need to go through each evidence and testimony carefully to spot any inconsistencies.

First, I'll list out the key points from the testimonies and evidences provided. Starting with the testimonies from Marlon Rimes (Character 8):

Testimony 1 from Rimes says that at 3:30 AM on July 20th, there was still water in the orca pool. Testimony 2 mentions the incident happened before the orca was moved to the show pool. Testimony 3 claims Orla killed Jack by lifting him 30 feet and making him hit the water.

Now, looking at the evidences. Evidence 12 (Shipley's Data) states that the estimated time of death was between 12:00 AM and 10:00 AM on July 20th. Also, the cause of death was a head contusion from a 65-foot fall into the pool. The pool's depth is mentioned in Evidence 3 as 65 feet. 

Wait, in Testimony 3, Rimes says the victim was slammed into the water from 30 feet high. But Evidence 12 says the fall was 65 feet. That's a discrepancy in the height of the fall. The testimony mentions 30 feet, but the evidence states 65 feet. That's a contradiction right there.

Another point: Evidence 3's Orca Pool Diagram mentions the pool is 65 feet deep. If the fall was from the ceiling to the bottom, that's consistent with the 65 feet in the evidence, but Rimes says 30 feet. So the height mentioned in the testimony doesn't match the evidence.

Additionally, Testimony 2 says the incident happened before moving Orla to the show pool. Evidence 17's Pool Bottom Photo shows the pool is partitioned into two sections by glass. If the orca was still in the main pool, maybe the movement is part of the timeline, but I need to check if that's conflicting with anything else. However, the main contradiction seems to be the fall height between Testimony 3 and Evidence 12.

So the conflicting pair would be Evidence 12 and Testimony 3. The testimony claims a 30-foot fall, but the evidence says it was a 65-foot fall. That's a clear contradiction.
</think>
